title: Client Report - Project 1: What’s in a Name?
text: THIS .qmd IS INSTRUCTIONAL AND SHOULD NOT BE USED TO WRITE YOUR REPORTS (EXCEPTION - PROJECT 0). THERE IS ANOTHER TEMPLATE FILE FOR THAT. YOU WILL NEED TO PREVIEW THE REPORT TO PRODUCE A .html FILE. YOU WILL SUBMIT THE .html FILE ON CANVAS.

title: Client Report - Project 1: What’s in a Name?
text:
Elevator pitch
Guess how often the name Mary is used today compared to the 80s? Could you guess how popular is your name John compare to the the time your were born? I build a report about that. i will be pleased to show you. That might influence how you want to name your upcoming baby A Client has requested this analysis and this is your one shot of what you would say to your boss in a 2 min elevator ride before he takes your report and hands it to the client.


Read and format project data
# Learn morea about Code Cells: https://quarto.org/docs/reference/cells/cells-jupyter.html

# Include and execute your code here
url = 'https://raw.githubusercontent.com/byuidatascience/data4names/master/data-raw/names_year/names_year.csv'

nameData = pd.read_csv(url)
nameData

nameData.columns
nameData.isna().sum()
nameData.describe()
nameData

title: Client Report - Project 1: What’s in a Name?
text:
Question|Task 1
Q1: How does your name at your birth year compare to its use historically?
_ANSWER 1: The name Angel was mostly used between 2000 and 2010.This statement is based on the trend line displays below. The shape of the line is caompared to a bell-shape line with the highest number of the name used in the middle. We can infer that between 2000 and 2010, the name Angel was mostly used and the use declined thereafter


Read and format data
# Include and execute your code here
# Filter data for the name "Angel" and the year 1994 onwards
myNameData = nameData.query('name == "Angel" and year >= 1994')
myNameData

(
    ggplot(
        myNameData,
        aes(x='year', y='Total')
    )
    + geom_line(aes(color='name'))
    + labs(
        title="The use of Angel from 1994 to 2015",
        subtitle="An increase of the usual of the name Angel from 1995 to 2006",
        x="Year",
        y="Total use of the Name Angel",
        legend="Total Use of:",
        color="Total Use"

    )
)

title: Client Report - Project 1: What’s in a Name?
text:
Question|Task 2
If you talked to someone named Brittany on the phone, what is your guess of his or her age? What ages would you not guess?
ANSWER2: If I talk to someone named Brittany, I will guess that He/she was born in the 90s. She is between 34 and 44 years old. But I will not guess that He/she is 60. This can be ullustrated by the chart below. We can see that the name Brittany was mostly used between 90s and never before 1980


plot example
# Include and execute your code here

britttanytable = nameData.query('name == "Brittany"')
britttanytable

(
  ggplot(
    britttanytable,
    aes(x='year', y = 'Total')
  )
  +geom_line(aes(color = 'name'))
  +labs(
    title = "Most people named Brittany were born between 1980 and 2002",
    subtitle  = "About 2.5% of the time, the name name Brittany was used after 2002",
    x = "Year",
    y= "Total use",
    color = "Total Use of the name:"

  )
)

title: Client Report - Project 1: What’s in a Name?
text:
Question|Task 3
Q3: Mary, Martha, Peter, and Paul are all Christian names. From 1920 - 2000, compare the name usage of each of the four names in a single chart. What trends do you notice?
ANSWER 3: The most used name among the 4 names was Mary. Also, the used of the four christian names drop drastically around 1960. Based on our analysis, we notice that those four names are no longer common in the recent years


table example
# Include and execute your code here
christianNames = nameData.query('(name =="Mary"or name =="Martha" or name == "Paul" or name == "Peter") and year > 1920 and year < 2000 ')
christianNames
(
  ggplot(
    christianNames,
    aes(x='year', y = 'Total')
  )
  +geom_line(aes(color = 'name'))
  +labs(
    title = "The comparaison of the Use of The christian name: Marta, Mary, Peter, John over the Year",
    subtitle  = "Drastic Decrease Use of the 4 christian Names from 1948",
    x = "Year",
    y= "Total use",
    color = "Total Use of the name:"

  )
)

Data Scientist, Mathematician, Statistician

MyLinkedIn | Email | Phone

Aspired to specialized in Fraud Detection, Financial Modeling, Predictive Analytics, Risk Assessment



Data Science, Business Analytics, Machine Learning, Statistical Modeling, Predictive Analysis




September 2024 - July 2026 Brigham Young University - Idaho, Rexburg, Idaho Bachelor of Science - Data Science Minor: Statistics Certificate: Full Stack Development Area of Interest: Fraud Detection, Financial Modeling, Predictive Analytics, Risk Assessment
January 2023 - April 2024 Ensign College, Salt Lake City, UT Certificate: Business Analytics GPA: 3.3 / 4.0 Emphasis: Data Science
September 2015 - December 2021 Felix Houphouet Boigny University, Abidjan, Cote D’Ivoire Bachelor of Science - Mathematics Developed critical thinking in statistical analysis, advanced calculus, and algebra




Data Analysis: Python, R, Excel, Pivot Tables, SQL, Qualtrics, HTML, CSS, JavaScript
Business Intelligence Tools: Tableau, Power BI, Looker Studio
Soft Skills: Teamwork, Communication, Problem Solving, Leadership, Time Management, French




January 2024 - July 2024 Data Analyst Intern, Bodyguardz Brands, Lehi, UT - Established database tables in BigQuery to securely store data from over 3 sources, improving efficiency by 40% and preserving 100% of historical data previously at risk of disappearing or getting deleted - Created a sales dashboard in Looker Studio using SQL in BigQuery, reducing reporting time by 30% - Fostered long-term colleague relationships via collaboration, enhancing cohesion and project success
January 2023 - January 2024 Data Analyst, Career and Internship Services, Ensign College, Salt Lake City, UT - Amplified productivity by 25% by using a Power BI dashboard to track mentor interactions with students - Created a data pipeline with Qualtrics to collect student survey responses, generating a live Power BI dashboard boosting career fair attendance by 25% - Partnered with data engineers to clarify project requirements, delivering product in 50% of allocated time
January 2020 - December 2022 Math Tutor, HomeSchool, Abidjan, Cote D’Ivoire - Tutored 13 12th grade students in calculus and algebra, achieving an 80% average score increase - Provided personalized training to 2 college juniors in statistics, leading to a 70% grade improvement



September 2024 - December 2024 Class Related Project
January 2024 - Present Data-Driven Decision Making Project, MIT Data Science Certificate / Brigham Young University - Data Science Association, Rexburg, Idaho - Designed a recommendation system in Python to help Amazon suggest products to customers - Engineered a machine learning model with Python to predict lead conversions, optimize resource allocation, and lift customer acquisition for an EdTech startup

include figures in chunks and discuss your findings in the figure.

    x="name", 
    y="AK"
)
chart.show()



                                                
My useless chart




table example

mydat = df.head(1000)\
    .groupby('year')\
    .sum()\
    .reset_index()\
    .tail(10)\
    .filter(["year", "AK","AR"])

display(mydat)

title: Ange K. Kouadio’s CV
text:
Data Analysis: Python, R, Excel, Pivot Tables, SQL, Qualtrics, HTML, CSS, JavaScript
Business Intelligence Tools: Tableau, Power BI, Looker Studio
Soft Skills: Teamwork, Communication, Problem Solving, Leadership, Time Management, French

title: Ange K. Kouadio’s CV
text:
January 2024 - July 2024 Data Analyst Intern, Bodyguardz Brands, Lehi, UT - Established database tables in BigQuery to securely store data from over 3 sources, improving efficiency by 40% and preserving 100% of historical data previously at risk of disappearing or getting deleted - Created a sales dashboard in Looker Studio using SQL in BigQuery, reducing reporting time by 30% - Fostered long-term colleague relationships via collaboration, enhancing cohesion and project success
January 2023 - January 2024 Data Analyst, Career and Internship Services, Ensign College, Salt Lake City, UT - Amplified productivity by 25% by using a Power BI dashboard to track mentor interactions with students - Created a data pipeline with Qualtrics to collect student survey responses, generating a live Power BI dashboard boosting career fair attendance by 25% - Partnered with data engineers to clarify project requirements, delivering product in 50% of allocated time
January 2020 - December 2022 Math Tutor, HomeSchool, Abidjan, Cote D’Ivoire - Tutored 13 12th grade students in calculus and algebra, achieving an 80% average score increase - Provided personalized training to 2 college juniors in statistics, leading to a 70% grade improvement

title: Ange K. Kouadio’s CV
text:
September 2024 - December 2024 Class Related Project
January 2024 - Present Data-Driven Decision Making Project, MIT Data Science Certificate / Brigham Young University - Data Science Association, Rexburg, Idaho - Designed a recommendation system in Python to help Amazon suggest products to customers - Engineered a machine learning model with Python to predict lead conversions, optimize resource allocation, and lift customer acquisition for an EdTech startup

title: Client Report - Project 1: What’s in a Name?
text:
Question|Task 4
__Q4: ## Question|Task 4
Q3: Mary, Martha, Peter, and Paul are all Christian names. From 1920 - 2000, compare the name usage of each of the four names in a single chart. What trends do you notice?
Answer: Titanic is one of the most popular movie release in 1997. the most use name in the movie is jack. We noticed that the use of the name Jack was dropping from 1940 to 1980 and started growing fromn 1990. The movie was released in 1997 and the use of the name was still increasing. Meaning, the realease of the movie didn’t impact a lot the used of the name Jack.


Show the code
jacktable = nameData.query('name == "Jack"')
jacktable

(
    ggplot(
        jacktable,
        aes(x='year', y='Total')
    )
    + geom_line(aes(color='name'), binwidth=10)
    + geom_vline(xintercept=1997, linetype="dashed", color="blue")
    + labs(
        title="The Impact of the Release of Titanic on the Use of the name Jack",
        subtitle="The highest Peak of the use of the name Jack was around 1930",
        x="Year",
        y="Total use",
        caption="Dashed blue line represents the release of Titanic in 1997",
        color="Total Use of the name:"
    )
)

STRECH|TASK 5
Q: Reproduce the chart Elliot using the data from the names_year.csv file


Show the code
elliottable = nameData.query('name == "Elliot"')
elliottable

(
    ggplot(
        elliottable,
        aes(x='year', y='Total')
    )
    + geom_line(aes(color='name'), binwidth=10)
    + geom_vline(xintercept=1997, linetype="dashed", color="blue")
    + labs(
        title="Elliot... What?",
        x="Year",
        y="Total",
        color="name:"
    )
    + theme(
        panel_background=element_rect(fill='#E5ECF6', color='#E5ECF6'),
        panel_grid_major=element_line(color='white'),
    )

)
